title: Why would you remove TT?
body: One of the funner parts of League of Legends is TT. Just stop....

replies.body:
TT is the only fast mode left, where you can queue up and pretty much play what you want. With it gone, there will be nothing but ARAM and SR, neither of which I'm fond of. I mean, I could understand if it was being replaced with something remotely  similar, but it's not.

Been playing LoL for 8 years, but now I'm being forced to quit because my favorite/main game mode is being taken away. I hate the way Riot treats the non SR portions of its playerbase. Any other game company wouldn't be able to get away with this. Words alone cannot explain my frustration.
They are getting rid of it cause almost no one plays it!

> [{quoted}](name=iPogoZ,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ewwEHvFP,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-08-02T14:04:48.961+0000)
>
> They are getting rid of it cause almost no one plays it!

Because the game mode has not been supported, even graphically, for most of league's existence. They don't even enforce on bots in normal tt, meaning if you want to go try the mode in norms you'll get put up against bots for a while or against full enemy teams while you have bots.. if you go into ranked it's only the people who know it inside and out but that's difficult to obtain until you get yourself a squad of dudes who are willing to jump into a match against 3 bots and be stuck doing nothing while they don't know the mode.
ARAM had the same number of changes and managed to be several times more popular. What's TT's excuse?

(1) people like the thin map 
(2) theres no auto healing so tanks have the best chance to win
(3) little legends are on aram (people love having cute things follow them)
(4) the mode is diverse because all champs are random and lets you experience new things

ARAM has a HUGE advantage over TT

> [{quoted}](name=DuskDaUmbreon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ewwEHvFP,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2019-08-03T12:27:49.683+0000)
>
> ARAM had the same number of changes and managed to be several times more popular. What's TT's excuse?

 Map needed more attention, itemization issues, vision system and color pallet, Potentially also the lane shape too

Because it has an abysmal playrate for a map?

2.5% playrate in NA, and I believe it only goes *down* from there. The mode was unsavable, because even when ARAM was just as neglected, it still managed several times the playrate.
Because riot hasn’t touched it for 4+ years

>, because even when ARAM was just as neglected, it still managed several times the playrate.

It's almost as if I addressed this exact issue. When ARAM had the exact same level of attention (less, I think, since I'm being told TT had some map-specific changes at some time in the past), it was still several times more popular.

Attention given to TT would have brought it up to a 5% playrate at best. Once Riot banned the bots it'd drop back to 3%.

The mode's dead and it's at the point where only necromancy can save the mode.
Twisted Treeline only received a change roughly every 2 years, ONE CHANGE, and the last one was in response to something that they did for summoner's rift...

> [{quoted}](name=Polaris I,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ewwEHvFP,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-08-02T13:44:22.369+0000)
>
> Because riot hasn’t touched it for 4+ years

Even when riot did things no one cared. Dont blame riot for the communities lack of interest. Its YOUR fault.
Somebody doesn't know how to market a product.
Even with an average of 1% playrate, that would put it at a million players by Riot's numbers. No reason to get rid of a game mode that is pulling in that kind of support.
Fun is a bit exaggeration.
Fun is objective, and last time i checked your opinion isn't the ultimate one.
But goes live.

And what about now?
Still not mine is the ultimate ?

_But goes live._
Was a mention to that, even if my opinion is not the _ultimate_ one, it is the one which goes to live servers.
Aka, removal, cuz it was not _fun_ enough to attract enough players to keep it online.

_No offense. Not here to argue._
You should really learn english

Around 98% of LoL's playerbase has no interest in it. It doesn't make much sense to support something like that. Maybe if the few people who did play it ever had any praise for it rather than just screaming about how neglected and broken it is, it might have gained some popularity.

why make a million people unhappy?  That's just lost revenue

also, it can't hurt to complain, given it has only received 2 updates in the entirety of league's seasons and most modern "incentives" to play work for ARAM and SR but not TT

> [{quoted}](name=3TWarrior,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ewwEHvFP,comment-id=00060001,timestamp=2019-08-24T01:46:39.239+0000)
>
> why make a million people unhappy?  That's just lost revenue
> 
> also, it can't hurt to complain, given it has only received 2 updates in the entirety of league's seasons and most modern "incentives" to play work for ARAM and SR but not TT

TT players were already unhappy with TT, and trying to make them happy turned out to be a waste of resources that could've been spent on making everyone else happy.

the last resources they put into TT were because of a change to SR and did almost nothing for the mode

it was the equivalent of the jungle change of season 8...only it did even less

Still what harm could it possibly cause by leaving it there?

It's been a mode since the start of league, no need to remove it now. If they were going to remove it they should have done that years ago.
Maybe they should make it permanent hexakill map and increase gold received like on aram. People might play it then

when missions, grades, balance changes visual updates (looks fine to me but apparently a huge percentage of people care more about how something looks than how it effective it is) and a variety of other features...

do not exist for it

maybe, but one key difference...they did those changes for ARAM
Hum? When was TT removed? Or announced to be removed? Did I miss a memo?

they announced it somewhere obscure about a week after the mouse cursor fiasco..

at this point, I'd say they have the type of people in charge who just make something up in an attempt to impress a superior in the company, hoping that person doesn't know anything about it

a cursor, quite literally a couple of kilobytes of data...was taking too many resources...in their logic.  Not "it's buggy" , or any sensible explanation, they literally said "time to throw it out like the vcr taking space in your house"

and as people have pointed out, despite having a playerbase in the MILLIONS, they're trying to retire TT
